gameDescription: In this gameplay scenario, players navigate the delicate Antarctic landscape considering the burgeoning tourist demand and the pressing need to conserve its unique ecosystem. As captains of futuristic AI-enabled airships, you transport tourists while facilitating scientific research and minimizing environmental impact. This takes place amidst the spellbinding wilderness of Antarctica and the burgeoning tourist demand.

blueTeam.name: Polar Protectors
blueTeam.description: Specializing in eco-friendly measures and sustainable tourism.

redTeam.name: Ice Watchers
redTeam.description: Explores novel ways of scientific research and minimizing tourist interference.

turns.scenario: The teams are about to choose their landing site for releasing the tourists

options.A: Choose a popular, already impacted area as the landing site
options.B: Select a pristine, untouched location as the landing site

AA.narrative: Both teams chose the already impacted area, minimizing additional impact to pristine locations. However, over-concentration of tourists results in accelerated wear on the selected site.

AB.narrative: The Ice Watchers chose the impacted area while Polar Protectors pick a new location. The untouched location now faces possible contamination while other areas face accelerated degradation.

BA.narrative: Polar Protectors opt for the impacted area while Ice Watchers choose untouched terrain. The pristine environment faces new challenges, while the already impacted area continues to degrade.

BB.narrative: Both teams choose pristine areas in an attempt to spread the impact. Despite good intentions, these untouched habitats now face the consequences of human intervention.

turns.scenario: Teams face a decision on managing the size of tourist influx

options.A: Allow a higher number of tourists, opening up potential for higher impact but more revenue
options.B: Limit the number of tourists to conserve ecosystem, which would translate into lower revenue

AA.narrative: Both teams decide to allow a larger number of tourists. The immediate impact on the local ecosystems is visible. However, the revenue generated increases substantially.

AB.narrative: Polar Protectors allow more tourists while Ice Watchers restrict entry. The imbalance leads to an unusual strain on Polar Protectors' zones while Ice Watchers territories remain fairly undisturbed

BA.narrative: Ice Watchers allows more tourists while Polar Protectors limit entry. Ice Watchers generate higher revenue but also face criticism due to visible ecosystem damage.

BB.narrative: Both teams decide to limit traffic. The environmental impact is substantially reduced, but the expectation of substantial revenue is compromised.

turns.scenario: Teams must choose a type of conservation activity

options.A: Engage tourists in conservation projects actively
options.B: Stress on implementing strict regulations and closing certain areas off to visitors

AA.narrative: Both teams involve tourists in conservation efforts. The tourists turn into conservation ambassadors, spreading the message of sustainability in their own circles.

AB.narrative: Polar Protectors actively engage tourists while Ice Watchers implement strict regulations. This leads to education and active conservation on one side and stringent protection on the other.

BA.narrative: Ice Watchers employ tourists in conservation while Polar Protectors enforce regulations. This unique approach sees both tourist engagement and conservation as complementary instead of conflicting.

BB.narrative: Strict regulations and area closures are implemented by both teams, which ensures that environment is conserved with minimum human interference.
